Constructor Detail

Marker

public Marker(MapPos mapPos,
              Label label,
              MarkerStyle markerStyle,
              java.lang.Object userData)
Default constructor (can be used if single style is sufficient for all zoom levels).

Parameters:
mapPos - position of the element. Position is defined in the coordinate system of the layer this element is attached to.
label - the label for the marker. Label is shown when the marker is selected. Can be null.
markerStyle - style for displaying the marker (color, texture, etc).
userData - custom user data associated with the element.

Marker

public Marker(MapPos mapPos,
              Label label,
              StyleSet<MarkerStyle> styles,
              java.lang.Object userData)
Constructor for the case when style depends on zoom level.

Parameters:
mapPos - position of the element. Position is defined in the coordinate system of the layer this element is attached to.
label - the label for the marker. Label is shown when the marker is selected. Can be null.
styles - style set defining how to display the marker.
userData - custom user data associated with the element.

Marker

public Marker(BillBoard.BaseElement baseElement,
              MarkerStyle markerStyle,
              java.lang.Object userData)
Constructor for the case when single style is sufficient for all zoom levels and position is based on another geometric element.

Parameters:
baseElement - base element that is used as a base for positioning the marker.
markerStyle - style to use for displaying the marker (size, color, etc).
userData - custom user data associated with the element.

Marker

public Marker(BillBoard.BaseElement baseElement,
              StyleSet<MarkerStyle> styles,
              java.lang.Object userData)
Constructor for marker if its style depends on zoom level and position is based on another geometric element.

Parameters:
baseElement - base element that is used as a base for positioning the marker.
styles - style set to use for displaying the marker.
userData - custom user data associated with the element.

getDisplayOrder

public int getDisplayOrder()
Get marker display order. Markers with higher order values are displayed on top of markers with lower order values.

Returns:
marker display order. Default is 0.

setDisplayOrder

public void setDisplayOrder(int displayOrder)
Change marker display order. Markers with higher order values are displayed on top of markers with lower order values. Note: this really works only when the corresponding layer is set to "2D mode", by calling MarkerLayer.setZOrdering(false). Otherwise the ordering is device-specific.

Parameters:
displayOrder - relative marker display order.

setActiveStyle

public void setActiveStyle(int zoom)
Description copied from class: VectorElement
This method is intended for vector layers - it will update element internal state based on zoom level.

Overrides:
setActiveStyle in class VectorElement
Parameters:
zoom - active zoom level.

getInternalState

public com.nutiteq.geometry.Marker.MarkerInternalState getInternalState()
Description copied from class: BillBoard
Not part of public API.

calculateInternalState

public void calculateInternalState()
Description copied from class: VectorElement
Not part of public API. This method should be called only vector layers - if layer internal state (like projection) changes, this method will recalculate internal state to reflect the change. The best pattern for implementation is to calculate the needed state and then call setInternalState at the end with newly constructed internal state object. NOTE: this method can be called from multiple threads, thus it should be implemented with this in mind.

getInternalEnvelope

public Envelope getInternalEnvelope()
Description copied from class: VectorElement
Calculate element envelope in internal coordinates.

Returns:
element envelope in internal coordinates
